{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage message}
that occurred in a {@link IStudioMetaChatSession chat session}.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioMetaChatSession.id } of the chat session to which it belongs

post.description:
Create a chat session share.

Create a chat session share {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare}.

The chat session share is a feature that allows you to share the chat session
with other users, and the other users can only read the chat session messages
without being able to send messages.

If you specify a specific message ID in the chat session share, the other
user can only read the chat session messages to the specified message ID.
The next message will not be displayed.

patch.summary: Retrieve the chat session share list
patch.description:
Retrieve the chat session share list.

Retrieve the chat session share {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare} list.

The returned {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare}s are 
{@link IPage paging} processed.

And depending on how you set the request information
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IRequest}, you can limit the number of
records per page by {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IRequest.limit}, 
search only sessions that meet a specific condition by
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IRequest.search}, or arbitrarily specify
the {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IRequest.sort sorting condition} of
the sessions.

put.description:
Update a chat session share.

Update a chat session share record; {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare}.

You can change {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IUpdate.title title} or
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare.IUpdate.message_id endpoint message}.

delete.description:
Erase a chat session share.

Erase a chat session share record; {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare}.

The chat session share will be deleted and the other user
will no longer be able to read the chat session messages.

get.description:
View individual chat session shares.

View the target chat session share details {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionShare}.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the target chat session share

patch.summary: Get list of messages in a chat session of shared
patch.description: Get list of messages in a chat session of shared.

post.description:
Create a repository.

{@link IHubCustomer customer} creates a {@link IStudioRepository repository}.

The repository created can belong to the customer {@link IHubMember member}'s
own {@link IStudioAccount account}, or it can belong to the
{@link IStudioEnterprise company} to which the customer belongs as a
{@link IStudioEnterpriseEmployee employee}.

In addition, the customer is automatically granted the owner
{@link IStudioRepositoryAccess permission} for the repository he or she created.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account he or she belongs to

patch.summary: Retrieval of the list of repository summary information
patch.description:
Retrieval of the list of repository summary information.

All {@link IStudioRepository.ISummary repository summary information}
existing in this studio system are retrieved by {@link IPage paging}.

However, {@link IStudioRepository.IRequest page request information} is
configured, and the scope of the search target can be limited to a specific
{@link IStudioAccount account}.

And the code of the account to which it belongs, *accountCode*, can be set
to `null`, in which case, all repositories accessible to the
{@link IHubCustommer customer} will be searched regardless of the account to
which it belongs. In other words, unless *accountCode* is `null`, only
repositories belonging to the account will be searched. And this is different
from {@link IStudioRepository.IRequest.ISearch.account.code}, in that the
account code used for the search is a similar search, and the code used in
this path parameter is an exact match search.

put.description:
Modify a repository.

Modify the public level, title, and search tags of a specific
{@link IStudioRepository repository}. The identifier code
{@link IStudioRepository.code} of the repository can also be modified through
this API function.

However, in order to modify a repository, the customer must have the top-level
administrator {@link IStudioRepositoryAccesss permission} for the repository.
Also, if the repository's attributed account is a member, it can be the
customer party, or if it is a company, it can be the customer's top-level
administrator employee of the company.

And if what you want to do is change/transfer the repository's attributable
account, use the {@link shift} function instead. Also, if you are modifying
an internal bucket, issue a new {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}.

delete.description:
Delete a repository.

{@link IHubCustomer customer} deletes a {@link IStudioRepository repository}
that he/she previously created.

Note that in order to delete a repository, you must actually be the owner
of the repository.

Simply being granted {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess permission} from the
repository does not change the ownership of the repository.

Also, if the target repository's affiliated account is not a
{@link IHubMember member} but a {@link IStudioEnterprise company}, the
current customer must be a {@link IStudioEnterpriseEmployee employee}
with the company's top-level admin permission.

get.description:
Get repository details.

Get details of a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository}.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

put.description:
Transfer Repository Ownership.

{@link IHubCustomer customer} transfers ownership of their
{@link IStudioRepository repository} to another {@link IStudioAccount account}.

Note that in order to transfer a repository, you must actually be the owner
of the repository.

You cannot change ownership of a repository by simply being granted
{@link IStudioRepositoryAccess permission} from the repository.

Also, if the target repository's owner account is a
{@link IStudioEnterprise company}, not a {@link IHubMember member}, the current
customer must be a {@link IStudioEnterpriseEmployee employee} with the company's
top-level administrator permission.

get.description:
Get repository details (by code).

Get the details of a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository},
using the {@link IStudioAccount account} and the repository code (`code`).

post.summary: Grants new access rights to a repository
post.description:
Grants new access rights to a repository.

A {@link IHubMember} or {@link IStudioEnterpriseTeam} with administrator
or higher level rights of a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository}
grants new {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access rights} to a new member or
enterprise team to the repository.

However, the person who can grant access rights must be an administrator or
owner of the repository.

And in the case of an administrator, only lower level rights can be granted,
and only the owner can grant "Owner" and "Administrator" level rights.

201.description: Details of the created repository access rights

patch.summary: Retrieve summary information list of repository access rights
patch.description:
Retrieve summary information list of repository access rights.

Retrieves summary information of all
{@link IStudioRepositoryAccess.ISummary access rights} granted to a specific
{@link IStudioRepository repository} {@link IPage paging}.

200.description: Summary information list of paged access rights

put.description:
Changes the repository access rights.

{@link IHubMember} or {@link IStudioEnterpriseTeam}, who has administrator
or higher level rights of a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository},
changes the existing {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access rights} for
a specific member or corporate team.

However, only the administrator or owner of the repository can change
the access rights.

In the case of an administrator, only lower-level rights can be changed,
and only the owner can change "Owner" and "Administrator" level rights.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess.id } of the target repository access rights

delete.description:
Revokes repository access rights.

{@link IHubMember} or {@link IStudioEnterpriseTeam}, who has administrator
level rights or higher for a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository},
revoke the existing {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access rights} for
a specific member or enterprise team.

However, only the administrator or owner of the repository can revoke
access rights.

In the case of an administrator, only lower-level rights can be revoked,
and only the owner can revoke "Owner" and "Administrator"-level rights.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess.id } of the target repository access rights

get.description:
Get access permission details.

Get the details of a specific {@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access permission}.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information about a bucket
get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a bucket.

Retrieves detailed information about a {@link IStudioRepositoryBucket bucket}
based on a specific {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}.

If the query target is a {@link IStudioRepositoryDirectory folder},
information about all buckets belonging to that folder is retrieved. However,
if there are many buckets, the amount of data itself may be huge. Therefore,
it is recommended to avoid retrieving detailed information about a folder,
and instead call the {@link index} function.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

patch.summary: Bucket details query by path
patch.description:
Bucket details query by path.

Retrieves details of {@link IStudioRepositoryBucket bucket} based on a
specific {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}, through its path,
{@link IStudioRepositoryBucket.path}.

If the query target is {@link IStudioRepositoryDirectory folder}, information
on all buckets belonging to that folder is retrieved, but the amount of data
itself may be huge because there are many buckets. Therefore, it is recommended
to avoid retrieving folder details, and instead call the {@link index} function.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

post.description:
Issue a new commit.

{@link IHubCustomer customer} edits {@link IStudioRepositoryBucket bucket files}
from {@link IStudioRepository repository}, and issues
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}.

Note that in order to commit, the customer must be granted
{@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access} of at least "member" from the repository,
and issuing a commit does not mean that the commit is final.

A commit can continue to {@link update modify}
{@link IStudioRepositoryBucket buckets}, and even cancel and
{@link erase delete} the commit, if the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at}
property, which indicates the time of its record fixation, is `null`.

The commit is finalized only by calling the {@link archive} method.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account you are affiliating

patch.summary: Retrieve the summary information list of commits in the repository
patch.description:
Retrieve the summary information list of commits in the repository.

{@link IStudioRepository repository}
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.ISummary commit summary information} is
retrieved by {@link IPage paging}.

Note that {@link IHubCustomer customer} is currently modifying, so in the case of
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commits that have not yet been recorded},
only the customer who created the commit can view it.

put.description:
Modify an existing commit.

Modify the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} already published by
{@link IHubCustomer customer}.

Of course, the target commit must have {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at}
property set to `null`. In other words, it must be a commit that has not been
finalized.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

delete.description:
Delete commit.

Cancel and delete the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} that was being
composed.

Of course, the target commit must still have the
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at} property as `null`. In other words,
it must be a commit that has not been finalized.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

get.description:
Get commit details.

Gets details of a specific {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} in the
{@link IStudioRepository repository}.

Note that {@link IHubCustomer customer} is currently modifying the
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commit that has not been recorded yet},
only the customer who created the commit can view it.

post.description:
Record a commit.

By recording all changes of {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}, complete
by recording them to {@link IStudioRepository repository}.

After recording the commit, {@link update modification} and
{@link erase deletion} are not possible at all.

Clone a repository.

Clone/create a new repository from a specific commit.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account you are affiliating with

post.description:
Deploy a program.

Deploy a program from a specific {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} of
this {@link IStudioRepository repository}.

{@link IHubCustomer Customer} can build and deploy a single program by
specifying target functions from each {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}
and {@link IStudioRepositoryFile script file} that make up the repository
(commit). In addition, a deployment copy can be generated and documentation
can be written about it.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

201.description: Details of the generated deployment program

repository.

Retrieves all
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease distribution program summary information} in
a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository} by {@link IPage paging}.

The distribution program summary information includes the version, date,
and document information of the distribution program.

put.summary: Modify the documentation of the distribution program
put.description:
Modify the documentation of the distribution program.

Modify the documentation and search tags of the
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease distributed program}.

It is not possible to modify the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} of
the existing distribution program, or to change the
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} to be `exported` or the
{@link IStudioRepositoryFile user-defined function} through this function. If you
want to do that, it is recommended to {@link erase} the current distribution
program and {@link create a new distribution}.

delete.description:
Delete the distribution program.

Delete the previously distributed program {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease}.

However, {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow documents} or
{@link IStudioRepositoryFile script files} of another
{@link IStudioRepository repository} that is already using the distribution
program by `importing` it will not be affected.

This is the same for programs already sold from the market.

post.description:
Create a workflow standalone.

An API function that creates a new {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow} file
from a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository} and publishes it to a
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}.

Since it creates only one workflow file when creating a commit, the returned
object type, {@link IStudioWorkflowStandalone}, contains the information of
the commit of the workflow at the same time.

Note that {@link IStudioRepsitoryCommit.archived_at archive} of the created
commit must be performed by going to the original commit API. In other words,
the original {@link HubApi.functional.studio.customers.repositories.commits.archive}
function must be called, not this group.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

put.description:
Modify Workflow.

API function to modify individual {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow} files from
a specific {@link IStudioRepository repository} of a
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at unarchived commit}.

Note that the last commit of the target repository must not be archived yet,
otherwise an error will occur. Also, the
{@link IStudioRepsitoryCommit.archived_at archive} of the modified commit must be

done by going to the original commit API. That is, the original
{@link HubApi.functional.studio.customers.repositories.commits.archive} function
must be called, not this group.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

post.description:
Accumulate Workflow.

An API function that exclusively modifies an existing
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow} file from a specific
{@link IStudioRepository repository} and issues a new
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}.

Since it modifies only one workflow document while issuing a commit, the
returned object type, {@link IStudioWorkflowStandalone}, contains the
information of the commit of the corresponding workflow at the same time.

Note that {@link IStudioRepsitoryCommit.archived_at archive} of the generated
commit must be performed by going to the original commit API. In other words, the
original {@link HubApi.functional.studio.customers.repositories.commits.archive}
function must be called, not this group.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

patch.summary: Retrieve the script connector list
patch.description:
Retrieve the script connector list.

From the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} and
{@link IStudioRepository repository} and {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit},
all available {@link IStudioWorkflowScriptConnector script connectors} are
retrieved. The returned script connectors are {@link IPage paging} processed and
filtered according to the search conditions.

Note that a workflow document is also a type of function, so a workflow document
is also a type of (script) connector function from the perspective of another
workflow document. Therefore, if you want to exclude the current workflow document
from the returned script connectors, you can filter them using
{@link IStudioWorkflowScriptConnector.IRequest.workflow_id}.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

parameters.name: commitId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.id } of the commit to which it belongs

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioWorkflow.id } of the workflow to which it belongs

patch.summary: Lookup script connectors individually
patch.description:
Lookup script connectors individually.

From the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} and
{@link IStudioRepository repository} and {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit},
specify the target script function (or other workflow document) individually,
and retrieve its {@link IStudioWorkflowScriptConnector script connector}
information.

Note that other workflow documents in the same repository can also be imported
as script connectors because workflow documents are also a type of function and
can be `imported`.

parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

patch.summary: Bulk query of Swagger documents registered in the workflow document
patch.description:
Bulk query of Swagger documents registered in the workflow document.

Batch query all Swagger documents registered in
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}. The returned Swagger document is
processed with {@link IPage paging}, and is wrapped in the form of
{@link IStudioWorkflowSwagger} for binding with
{@link IStudioWorkflowSwaggerConnector connector}.

Note that this information is also recorded in the workflow main document
({@link IStudioWorkflowData.swaggers}), so when querying a workflow document,
you do not need to call this API directly. Use it only when you want to query
the Swagger documents used there, separately from other workflow documents.

parameters.name: accountCode

post.summary: Convert Swagger document to connector structure
post.description:
Convert Swagger document to connector structure.

Convert {@link ISwagger Swagger document} to a connector structure that can
be used in the current {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}.

The returned object {@link IStudioWorkflowSwagger} contains the original
Swagger information, and a list of
{@link IStudioWorkflowSwaggerConnector connectors}.

Each connector matches the original Swagger's {@link ISwaggerOperation} based
on the endpoint's path and method.

parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

patch.summary: Retrieve the list of temporary storage records
patch.description:
Retrieve the list of temporary storage records.

Retrieves the list of {@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary.ISummary}, which is
the summary information of the temporary storage records of the target
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}. The returned information is
processed by {@link IPage paging} and filtered according to the search conditions.

Note that the entity that temporarily stores the workflow document is the
front application, and each temporary storage record is deleted in bulk at the
moment when the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commit is confirmed}.
Also, for the attributed commit and workflow document, if the number of temporary
storage records exceeds N, they are automatically deleted.

Therefore, even if the previously created temporary storage records are not
found in the list, this may not be a normal bug but a specification, so please
note this.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

parameters.name: commitId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.id } of the commit to which it belongs

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioWorkflow.id } of the workflow to which it belongs

post.summary: Create a temporary storage record for a workflow document
post.description:
Create a temporary storage record for a workflow document.

Currently, {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commit being edited}
and {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} create a new
{@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary temporary storage record}.

This API is executed by the front application and should be called by the
system's scheduler, not a human.

Note that if the attributable commit has already been recorded, temporary
storage cannot be performed any more, and a `422 unprocessable entity` error
occurs.

And along with the recording of the attributable commit, all temporary storage
records for the corresponding commit are deleted in bulk.

Therefore, even if the creation of a temporary storage record fails or the
previously created temporary storage record is no longer queried, this may be
a part of the specification, not a bug, so please keep this in mind.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

parameters.name: commitId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.id } of the commit to which it belongs

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioWorkflow.id } of the workflow to which it belongs

201.description: Summary information about the generated temporary storage record

get.description:
Retrieve temporary storage records.

Retrieve the temporary storage record {@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary} of
the workflow document.

And according to the query information {@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary.IQuery},
the retrieved records are deleted at the same time.

For reference, the entity that temporarily stores the workflow document is the front application, and each temporary
storage record is deleted in bulk at the moment when the associated {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commit is confirmed}. And for the associated commit and workflow document, even if the number of temporary
storage records exceeds N, they are automatically deleted.

Therefore, even if the previously created temporary storage record is not
retrieved in this API, this may not be a normal bug but a specification, so
please note this.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioAccount.code } of the account to which it belongs

parameters.name: repositoryCode
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepository.code } of the repository to which it belongs

parameters.name: commitId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.id } of the commit to which it belongs

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: {@link IStudioWorkflow.id } of the workflow to which it belongs

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: {@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary.id } of the target temporary record

parameters.name: erase
parameters.title: Whether to delete
parameters.description:
Whether to delete.

Whether to view the temporary storage record and delete the record.

200.description: Detailed information about the target temporary record

delete.description:
Delete temporary storage records.

Delete the target {@link IStudioWorkflowTemporary temporary storage record}.

However, temporary storage is only possible when the
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} has not been
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at recorded}. And the moment the
committed commit is recorded, it is deleted in bulk.

In addition, it is possible to {@link at individually query} the temporary
storage record and delete it at the moment of querying.

Therefore, even if the temporary storage record that was created has already
been deleted even though this API function has not been called, this is not
a bug but a specification. Please note this.

parameters.name: accountCode

patch.description:
Retrieve a list of summary information for workflow documents on the
workspace shelves.

Returns a list of {@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow.ISummary} containing summary
information of workflow documents and {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commits} and
{@link IStudioRepository repositories} that {@link IPage customers} have placed
on the workspace shelves.

The returned objects indicate that the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}
has never been {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease deployed}. If a particular workflow
document has been deployed even once, it is classified as a
{@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow}, which means a bookshelf in the distribution
so the {@link HubApi.functional.customers.shelves.releases.workflows.index}
function should be used instead.

200.description: Summary information about the workflow documents on the workspace bookshelf.

patch.summary: Retrieve the list of workflow documents in the workshop bookshelf
patch.description:
Retrieve the list of workflow documents in the workshop bookshelf.

Returns a list of {@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow} containing the workflow
documents and details of the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} and
{@link IStudioRepository repository} that {@link IHubCustomer customer} has
placed in the workshop bookshelf, and {@link IPage paging} them.

The returned objects indicate that the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}
has never been {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease deployed}. If a particular workflow
document has been deployed even once, it is classified as a
{@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow}, which means a bookshelf in the distribution,
so the {@link HubApi.functional.customers.shelves.releases.workflows.details}
function should be used instead.

200.description: Summary information about the workflow documents on the workspace bookshelf.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a workflow document that is placed on a bookshelf
in a workshop.

Returns a {@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow} object that contains the details
of the workflow document that {@link IHubCustomer customer} placed on the
bookshelf in the workshop and the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit}
and {@link IStudioRepository repository}.

The returned object means that the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}
has never been {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease deployed}. If a particular
workflow document has been deployed even once, it is classified as a
{@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow}, which means a bookshelf in the distribution,
so the {@link HubApi.functional.customers.shelves.releases.workflows.at} function
should be used instead.

200.description: Details of the workflow document on the workspace bookshelf.

patch.description:
Retrieve a list of summary information for workflow documents placed
on the distribution shelf.

Returns a list of {@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow.ISummary} containing
summary information of workflow documents placed on the distribution shelf by
{@link IHubCustomer customer} and {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease distribution}
and {@link IStudioRepository repository}, by {@link IPage paging}.

The returned objects indicate that the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document}
has been {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease deployed} at least once. If a particular
workflow document has never been deployed, it is classified as
{@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow}, which means a workspace shelf, and the
{@link HubApi.functional.customers.shelves.commits.workflows.index} function
should be used instead.

200.description: Summary information about the workflow documents on the distribution shelf.

get.summary: Retrieve details of workflow documents placed on the distribution shelf
get.description:
Retrieve details of workflow documents placed on the distribution shelf.

Returns a {@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow} object containing details of
workflow documents placed on the distribution shelf by
{@link IHubCustomer customer} and the associated
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease distribution} and
{@link IStudioRepository repository}.

The returned object means that the associated
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} has been
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease deployed} at least once. If a particular
workflow document has never been deployed, it is classified as a
{@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow}, which means a workspace shelf, so the
{@link HubApi.functional.customers.shelves.commits.workflows.at} function should
be used instead.

200.description: Details of the workflow document on the distribution shelf.

Retrieve the list of widget tiles.

Loads {@link IStudioAccountWidgetTile tiles} belonging to a specific
{@link IStudioAccount account} and widget, in units of pages.

However, unlike general pagination APIs, widgets perform
{@link IGeometryPage pagination} by
{@link IStudioAccountWidgetTile.IGeometry 2D spatial coordinates and size},
not scalar values (e.g. page 1).

Specify this point, move to the area of the page you want to retrieve, and
perform the pagination task.

patch.summary: Retrieval of the list of repository summary information
patch.description:
Retrieval of the list of repository summary information.

All {@link IStudioRepository.ISummary repository summary information}
existing in this studio system are retrieved by {@link IPage paging}.

However, {@link IStudioRepository.IRequest page request information} is
configured, and the scope of the search target can be limited to a specific
{@link IStudioAccount account}.

And the code of the account to which it belongs, *accountCode*, can be set
to `null`, in which case, all repositories accessible to the
{@link IHubCustommer customer} will be searched regardless of the account to
which it belongs. In other words, unless *accountCode* is `null`, only
repositories belonging to the account will be searched. And this is different
from {@link IStudioRepository.IRequest.ISearch.account.code}, in that the
account code used for the search is a similar search, and the code used in
this path parameter is an exact match search.

Temporarily compile workflow documents.

Temporarily compile only the current {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow} document.

This compilation also occurs when building the
{@link IStudioWorkflowRepositoryRelease distribution program} from the
original repository. This API is separate from that, and performs partial
compilation only for individual workflow documents and some script files
`imported` from them.

Its main purpose is to test the operation of individual workflows, etc.

rss.description:
Resident Set Size, is the amount of space occupied in the main memory device (that is a subset of the total allocated memory) for the
process, including all C++ and JavaScript objects and code.

arrayBuffers.description:
Refers to memory allocated for `ArrayBuffer`s and `SharedArrayBuffer`s, including all Node.js Buffers. This is also included
in the external value. When Node.js is used as an embedded library, this value may be `0` because allocations for `ArrayBuffer`s
may not be tracked in that case.

becomes `true`, and vice versa.

IHubCustomer.description:
Customer information, but based on access criteria, not people.

`IHubCustomer` is an entity that literally embodies the information of
those who participated in the market as customers. `IHubCustomer` issues
a new record for each access, even if it is the same person.

The first purpose is to track the customer inflow path in detail, and the
second is to prevent cases where the same person enters as a non-member,
diligently puts {@link IHubSale items} in the
{@link IHubCartCommodity shopping cart}, and only then does
{@link IHubCitizen real name authentication} or
{@link IHubMember membership registration/login} at the moment of payment.
Lastly, the same person may access {@link IHubExternalUser external service}
to make a purchase, create multiple accounts to make a purchase, be a non-member
and then only authenticate their real name to make a purchase, and sometimes
become a member and act as a {@link IHubSeller seller} or
{@link IHubAdministrator administrator}, etc. This is to accurately track the
activities that a person performs on the exchange in various ways.

Therefore, `IHubCustomer` can have multiple records with the same
{@link IHubCitizen} or {@link IHubMember} and {@link IHubExternalUser}. Also,
if a customer signs up for membership after authenticating their real name or
signs up for our service after being an external service user, all related
records are changed at once. This makes it possible to identify and track
customers very systematically.

IHubMember.description:
General member account.

`IHubMember` is an entity that represents a case where a
{@link IHubCustomer customer} registers as a general member in this system.

Note that if the value of {@link IHubMember.seller} or
{@link IHubMember.administrator} is not `null`, it means that the member also
registers and acts as a seller and administrator.

Conversely, if you want a structure that reversely references member and
customer information from administrators and sellers, use the structure
below instead.

- {@link IHubAdministrator.IInvert}
- {@link IHubSeller.IInvert}

IHubCitizen.description:
Citizen authentication information.

{@link IHubCitizen} is an entity that records the user's real name and
mobile phone input information.

For reference, in Korea, real name authentication is mandatory for
e-commerce participants, so the {@link name} attribute is important. However,
the situation is different overseas, so in reality, the {@link mobile} attribute
is the most important, and individual user identification is also based on this
{@link mobile} attribute.

Of course, real name and mobile phone authentication information are encrypted
and stored.

IHubAdministrator.description:
Administrator.

`IHubAdministrator` is an entity that literally means an administrator,
and refers to a person who has registered as a {@link IHubMember member}
in this system and performs management activities such as
{@link IHubSaleAudit review}.

Note that `IHubAdministrator` is different from
{@link IHubExternalUser external user} or {@link IHubCustomer} that can perform
non-member activities, but only those who have registered as a
{@link IHubMember member} can perform management activities. And
{@link IHubCitizen real-name authentication} is also required.

created_at.title: The date and time the record was created

IHubSeller.description:
Seller information.

`IHubSeller` is an entity that literally means a seller, and refers to
a person who registers {@link IHubMember} in this system, registers
{@link IHubSale API listings}, and conducts {@link IHubOrder sales} activities.

Note that `IHubSeller` is different from {@link IHubExternalUser external users}
and {@link IHubCustomer}, which allows non-member activities, and only those
who register as {@link IHubMember members} can conduct sales activities.
And {@link IHubCitizen real-name authentication} is also required.

IHubChannel.description:
Hub channel information.

`IHubChannel` is a concept that visualizes distribution channels
in the API brokerage market. In this system, a different channel means
a different site or application. Therefore, Wrtn Generative Hub
(https://hub.wrtn.com, tentative name) is also a channel.

The basic code is `wrtn`. Of course, there is only one channel for
Generative Hub at present, but it is prepared in advance for future scalability.
Like {@link IHubExternalUser}, it is a concept designed in advance for possible
partnerships in the future. For reference, if Wrtn launches another site
(application) with a different brand name in addition to Generative Hub,
or if Wrtn uses (<iframe> ) If you are launching a simple hub site to distribute
to your partners, you will also need a new channel.

IHubExternalUser.description:
External user information.

`IHubExternalUser` is an entity for when this system connects to an external
service and needs to accept their users as {@link IHubCustomer customers}
of this service.

For reference, customers who access from an external service must have this
record, and the external service user is identified through the two properties
{@link application} and {@link uid}.

If a customer who accessed from an external service completes
{@link IHubCitizen real-name authentication} from this service, the external
service user starts with the real-name authentication completed whenever he or
she re-accesses this service and issues a new customer authentication token.
This is the same when signing up for {@link IHubMember} membership.

And {@link IHubExternalUser.ICreate.password} is the password issued by the
external service system to the user (so-called permanent user authentication token),
and is never the actual user password. However, this is to determine whether
a customer who entered the same {@link application} and {@link uid} as
the current external system user is a valid external system user or a violation.

In addition, additional information received from an external service can be
recorded in the {@link data} field in JSON format.

IHubCoupon.description:
Discount coupon.

`IHubCoupon` is an entity that embodies a discount coupon on the exchange.

However, `IHubCoupon` only contains the specification information
for the discount coupon.

Please note that this is a different concept from {@link IHubCouponTickeet},
which means issuing a discount coupon, or {@link IHubCouponTicketPayment},
which means paying it.

In addition, discount coupons are applied to {@link IHubOrder order} units,
but each has its own unique {@link IHubCouponCriteria constraints}. For example,
a coupon with {@link IHubCouponCriteriaOfSeller seller constraints} can only be
used for {@link IHubSale listings} registered by the corresponding
{@link IHubSeller seller}, or cannot be used. There are also restrictions such as
a minimum amount limit for using a discount coupon, and a maximum discount amount.

In addition, you can set whether the discount coupon is issued publicly or only
to those who know a specific issuance code. In addition, there are restrictions
such as an expiration date for the issued discount coupon, or that it is issued
only to customers who come in through a specific path.

For more information, please refer to the properties and sub-entities below.

threshold.description:
Minimum purchase amount for discount.

If this value is set, the discount coupon will not be applied to orders that fall below this value.

If this value is set, the discount coupon will not be applied to orders that fall below this value.

limit.description:

If you set this value, no matter how much you order, it will not be discounted more than that amount.

access.description:
Can discount coupons be viewed publicly?

- `public`: Coupons available for ordering can be viewed in bulk
- `private`: Unable to view in bulk
- Randomly assigned by the seller or administrator
- Can only be issued through a one-time link

exclusive.title: Exclusivity
exclusive.description:
Exclusivity.

An exclusive discount coupon refers to a discount coupon that has
an exclusive relationship with other discount coupons and can
only be used alone. In other words, when an exclusive discount coupon
is used, no other discount coupons can be used for the same
{@link IHubOrder order} or {@link IHubOrderGood product}.

volume.title: Issuance quantity limit
volume.description:
Issuance quantity limit.

If there is a limit on the issuance quantity, it is impossible to issue
tickets exceeding this value.

That is, the concept of first-come-first-served N coupons is created.

volume_per_citizen.title: Limit the issuance quantity per person
volume_per_citizen.description:
Limit the issuance quantity per person.

As a limit on the total issuance quantity per person, it is common
to assign 1 to limit duplicate issuance to the same citizen, or use
the `null` value to not impose a limit.

Of course, you can limit the total issuance quantity to the same citizen
by assigning a value of N.

expired_in.title: Expiration date
expired_in.description:
Expiration date.

The concept is that after receiving a discount coupon ticket,
it expires after N days.

Therefore, customers should consume the ticket within N days
after it is issued.

expired_at.title: Expiration date
expired_at.description:
Expiration date.

The concept of expiration after YYYY-MM-DD has passed after
the discount coupon ticket is issued.

Can be double-constrained with {@link expired_in}.

IHubCouponCriteriaOfChannel.description:
Conditions for the channel of the discount coupon.

`IHubCouponCriteriaOfChannel` is a subtype entity of
{@link IHubCouponCriteriaBase}, and is used to set conditions for a specific
{@link IHubChannel channel} or a {@link IHubChannelCategory category} of the
channel.

If the hub_coupon_criterias.direction value is "include", the coupon can be
used only for the corresponding channel (or category), and if it is "exclude",
the coupon cannot be used. And if there are multiple
`hub_coupon_criteria_of_channels` records in a coupon, then the condition is set
for each group. For the target channels and categories, the coupon can be applied
or not applied.

expired_at.title: The time when the APIs of the current listing (snapshot) are stopped
expired_at.description:
The time when the APIs of the current listing (snapshot) are stopped.

Since the transaction target is an API, the seller should not
immediately delete the listing just because it has stopped selling.
It should guarantee a minimum period of use, so that customers using
the API will respond to this.

Therefore, when the listing is stopped, it is made to disappear after
a certain grace period.

Of course, if it is a listing that has never been sold, it does not apply.

suspended_at.title: Temporary suspension of sales
suspended_at.description:
Temporary suspension of sales.

The seller has suspended sales for some reason.

Customers will not be able to view the listing or details page at all.
At first glance, it looks similar to a soft delete, but the difference is
that the seller and the administrator can still view it, and the sale can
be resumed at any time.

Also, even if the seller has suspended, previous buyers of the listing
can still use the API. The time of suspension of the API can be found in
the {@link IHubSaleSnapshot.expired_at} property.

IHubChannelCategory.description:
Channel category information.

`IHubChannelCategory` is a concept that means a classification category
within a specific channel, and it is exactly the same as the concept that
is usually referred to as "category" in the exchange.

And `IHubChannelCategory` means a "corner", which is an independent
spatial information in the offline market, and unlike {@link IHubSection},
where simultaneous classification of {@link IHubSale listings} is impossible,
one listing can be classified into multiple categories at the same time.

For example, beef and grapes can belong to the fruit corner and the meat corner,
respectively, but they do not belong to any of the categories, and can form
independent M:N relationships with various categories according to the
characteristics of each product.

Product | Corner       | Classification
--------|--------------|-----------------------------------
Beef    | Meat Corner  | Frozen Food, Meat, Specialty Food
Grape   | Fruit Corner | Fresh food, convenience food

In addition, the categories have a 1: N recursive structure, so a
hierarchical expression is possible as shown below. Also, you can set
different categories for each {@link IHubChannel channel}, so you can
freely set the category classification you want for each channel.

- Grocery > Meat > Frozen
- Electronics > Laptop > 15-inch
- Miscellaneous goods > Wallets

Also, since the API supports (or plans to support) a merge function
between multiple categories, there will be no particular burden in
constantly editing the categories.

created_at.description: The date and time the record was created.

knock_count.title: Knock count
knock_count.description:

including the number of cases that have not yet been {@link IHubOrder.published_at published}.

- (not published) = (knock) - (publish)

publish_count.title: Number of sales
publish_count.description:
Number of sales.

IHubCouponCriteriaOfFunnel.description:
Limiting the inflow path of discount coupons.

{@link IHubCouponCriteriaOfFunnel} is a subtype entity of
{@link IHubCouponCriteria}, and is used when you want to issue or exclude
{@link IHubCoupon discount coupons} only to customers who come from
a specific path.

And limiting the inflow path is possible in three ways as follows. First is
{@link IHubCustomer.referrer}, and in addition, by parsing
{@link IHubCustomer.href}, which records the customer's access address,
restrictions can be applied to specific URLs or variable units.

value.title: The amount of deposit/withdrawal
value.description:
The amount of deposit/withdrawal.

Must be a positive number, and whether or not a deposit/withdrawal is made can be seen in {@link IHubDeposit.direction}.

If you want to express the deposit/withdrawal values as positive/negative numbers, you can also multiply this field value by the {@link IHubDeposit.direction} value.

created_at.description: Record creation date and time

IHubDepositDonation.description:
Deposit Donation.
{@link IHubDepositDonation} is an entity that embodies the case where
an administrator directly donates a deposit to a specific customer citizen.

It is designed assuming that the customer will directly deliver the deposit
in person, rather than through our payment system.

In some cases, it is also possible to sign a postpaid contract with a specific
company and provide the company with an appropriate amount of deposit every
month.

If you want to express the deposit/withdrawal values as positive/negative numbers, you can also multiply this field value by the {@link IHubDeposit.direction} value.

IHubDeposit.description:
This is an entity that visualizes the specifications for deposit and
withdrawal in the exchange.

{@link IHubDeposit} is not {@link IHubDepositHistory}, which means the deposit
and withdrawal history of the deposit, but is simply metadata that specifies
the specifications for the scenario in which the deposit is deposited and
withdrawn. Please note that this gen-hub cannot pay cash immediately at the
time of the customer's purchase of the goods (the time of the API call) due to
the nature of the API as a transaction object.

Instead, this system charges the customer with a deposit and deducts it
every time the API is called.

jmesPath.title: Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression
jmesPath.description:
Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression.

`Prerequisite.Props.jmesPath` is a string typed property that extracts desired values
from the prerequisite API response using a JMESPath expression. This property simplifies
and replaces the `label`, `value`, and `array` properties.

JMESPath expressions are used to extract the desired data based on the API response.
The expression must always be a valid JMESPath syntax.

- Type: `jmesPath: string`
- Example: `"members[*].data.title"`
- Usage: `jmespath.search(response, jmesPath)`

Note: The `label`, `value`, and `array` properties are no longer in use.

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

label.title: Transform function returning label
label.description:
Transform function returning label.

`Prerequisite.Props.label` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the label from the element instance of the
prerequisite API respond array.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are
always `elem`, `index` and `array`. Of course, the function's
return type must be always `string`.

- type: `label: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => string`
- example: `return elem.title`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", labelScript)(...)`

value.title: Transform function returning target value
value.description:
Transform function returning target value.

`Prerequisite.Props.value` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the target value from the element instance of
the prerequisite API respond array. If you've defined this `Prerequisite`
type to a `number` type, the returned value must be actual number type.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are always
`elem`, `index` and `array`.

- type: `value: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => Value`
- example: `return elem.no`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", valueScript)(...)`

array.title: Transform function returning array instance
array.description:
Transform function returning array instance.

`Prerequisite.Props.array` is a string typed property representing
a function returning an array instance from the response of the
prerequisite API.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter name is
always `response`.

If the prerequisite API responses an array and it is the desired one,
you don't need to specify this property.

- type: `array: (response: Response) => Elemenet[]`
- example: `return response.members.map(m => m.data)`
- how to use: `new Function("response", arrayScript)(response)`

prefixItems.title: Prefix items
prefixItems.description:
Prefix items.

The `prefixItems` means the type schema info of the prefix items in the
tuple type. In the TypeScript, it is expressed as `[T1, T2]`.

If you want to express `[T1, T2, ...TO[]]` type, you can configure the
`...TO[]` through the {@link additionalItems} property.

additionalItems.title: Additional items
additionalItems.description:
Additional items.

The `additionalItems` means the type schema info of the additional items
after the {@link prefixItems}. In the TypeScript, if there's a type
`[T1, T2, ...TO[]]`, the `...TO[]` is represented by the `additionalItems`.

By the way, if you configure the `additionalItems` as `true`, it means
the additional items are not restricted. They can be any type, so that
it is equivalent to the TypeScript type `[T1, T2, ...any[]]`.

Otherwise configure the `additionalItems` as the {@link IJsonSchema},
it means the additional items must follow the type schema info.
Therefore, it is equivalent to the TypeScript type `[T1, T2, ...TO[]]`.

uniqueItems.title: Unique items restriction

properties.description:

The `properties` means a list of key-value pairs of the object's
regular properties. The key is the name of the regular property,
and the value is the type schema info.

If you need additional properties that is represented by dynamic key,
you can use the {@link additionalProperties} instead.

additionalProperties.title: Additional properties' info
additionalProperties.description:
Additional properties' info.

The `additionalProperties` means the type schema info of the additional
properties that are not listed in the {@link properties}.

If the value is `true`, it means that the additional properties are not
restricted. They can be any type. Otherwise, if the value is
{@link IOpenAiSchema} type, it means that the additional properties must
follow the type schema info.

- `true`: `Record<string, any>`

When this property be configured, the Restful API operation requires
the matched security value for exection. Its key means security key
matched with {@link OpenApi.IDocument.security}.

The value means scopes required for the security key when the security

would be empty array.

`ISwaggerOperation` represents an Restful API operation provided by the

name.title: Representative name of the parameter
name.description:
Representative name of the parameter.

In the most case, the `name` is equivalent to parameter variable name.
Therefore, the `name` must be filled with the significant variable name
of the parameter.

By the way, only when the {@link in} property is `path`, the `name`
can be omitted. In that case, the `name` is automatically deduced from
the URL path's positional template argument analyzing.

in.title: Location of the parameter
in.description:
Location of the parameter.

The `in` property is a string that determines the location of the parameter.

- `path`: parameter is part of the path of the URL.
- `query`: parameter is part of the query string.
- `header`: parameter is part of the header.
- `cookie`: parameter is part of the cookie.

required.title: Whether the parameter is required for execution or not
required.description:
Whether the parameter is required for execution or not.

If the parameter is required, the value must be filled. Otherwise,
it is possible to skip the parameter when executing the APi operation.

For reference, the `required` property must be always `true` when the
{@link in} property is `path`. Otherwise, the `required` property can
be anything of them; `true`, `false` and `undefined`.

examples.title: Collection of example values of the parameter with keys

IHubOrderGoodIssueComment.description:
Comments on an article about an issue related to a purchased product.

A subtype entity of {@link IBbsArticleComment}, used when customers and
sellers communicate with each other about an issue written about an
ordered product.

Note that comments can still be written even after the issue has been closed.

As mentioned in {@link IBbsArticleComment}, designed to keep evidence
and prevent fraud.

writer.title: Author
writer.description:
Author.

Written by {@link IHubCustomer} or {@link IHubSeller}.

snapshots.title: List of snapshot contents
snapshots.description:
List of snapshot contents.

It is created for the first time when an article is created, and is
accumulated every time the article is modified.

created_at.title: Creation time of article
created_at.description: Creation time of article.

IHubOrderGoodIssue.description:
Purchased product related issue article.

{@link IHubOrderGoodIssue} is a bulletin board where customers and sellers
can raise issues with each other regarding products that customers have ordered
and paid for.

Customers and sellers can write issue posts by topic for products and continue
discussions in the comments.

In addition, among the types of issues, customers can request additional work
such as custom production or modification from sellers. In this case, sellers
can charge customers a fee and claim reasonable costs for the additional work.

Lastly, the customer or seller who wrote the issue can close it (closed_at)
after completing it. However, even after closing the issue, comments can continue
to be written on the issue, and it is also possible for sellers to charge a fee.

value.title: Amount of the attorney's fee
value.description: Amount of the attorney's fee.

accept.description:
{@link IHubOrderGoodIssueFeeAccept}
Value exists only if the issue fee is accepted.

created_at.title: The time at which the fee was charged
created_at.description: The time at which the fee was charged.

IHubOrderGoodIssueFee.description:
Offering a fee for resolving an issue.

{@link IHubOrderGoodIssueFee} refers to the fee that the seller offers
to the customer when resolving an issue regarding a product ordered by the customer.
This usually occurs when the customer requests additional work such as
customization or modification through the issue.

The customer may pay the fee in response, refuse it, or, in some cases,
negotiate the price.

If the seller wants to adjust the price in response, the current record can be
deleted and a new fee record can be reissued.

customer.description:
{@link IHubCustomer}

Customer who has been billed a fee.

created_at.title: The date and time the record was created
created_at.description: The date and time the record was created.

published_at.title: Effective date and time of acceptance of the fee
published_at.description: Effective date and time of acceptance of the fee.

canceled_at.title: Date of cancellation of the fee
canceled_at.description:
Date of cancellation of the fee.

Cancellation is not possible after the effective date.

IHubOrderGoodIssueFeeAccept.description:
This is an entity that embodies the act of a customer accepting and
accepting the issue fee charged by the seller.

Note that the moment the customer accepts the fee and the moment it takes
effect can be different.

In other words, it is possible to accept the fee at this point and have
the deposit withdrawn, but postpone the effect of this, so that the seller
can start work in the future, or to leave room for a change of mind
in the future.

created_at.title: Creation time of snapshot record
created_at.description:
Creation time of snapshot record.

In other words, creation time or update time or article.

format.title: Format of body
format.description:
Format of body.

Same meaning with extension like `html`, `md`, `txt`.

IBbsArticle.ISnapshot.description:
Snapshot of article.

`IBbsArticle.ISnapshot` is a snapshot entity that contains the contents of
the article, as mentioned in {@link IBbsArticle}, the contents of the article
are separated from the article record to keep evidence and prevent fraud.

IPageIHubSaleSnapshot.IInvert.description:
A page.

Collection of records with pagination indformation.

seller.title: The seller who listed the item
seller.description: The seller who listed the item.

latest.title: Last snapshot
latest.description:
Last snapshot.

Is this snapshot the last snapshot of the property?

However, the criteria for "last" vary depending on the perspective of
the user viewing this property.

- Customer perspective: The most recently approved property
- Seller/Administrator: The most recently created property

channels.title: Channel/Category List
channels.description:
Channel/Category List.

A list of channels and categories in which this item is sold.

aggregate.title: Aggregate/performance information for this listing (or snapshot)
aggregate.description: Aggregate/performance information for this listing (or snapshot).

content.title: Content information

units.title: Unit List
units.description:
Unit List.

A record representing the products currently being sold, containing
information about the {@link IHubSaleUnitOption options} that can be
set for each product, and the {@link IHubSaleUnitStock stock} that
can be configured by selecting options.

version.title: Version name
version.description:
Version name.

You can set a different value than {@link ISwaggerInfo.version}.

That is, the version name in the server spec (Swagger document) and
the version name in the product may be different.

activated_at.title: Activation time of the snapshot
activated_at.description:
Activation time of the snapshot.

The time this snapshot was first activated after it was approved for review.

expired_at.title: The time when the APIs of the current listing (snapshot) are stopped
expired_at.description:
The time when the APIs of the current listing (snapshot) are stopped.

Since the transaction target is an API, the seller should not
immediately delete the listing just because it has stopped selling.
It should guarantee a minimum period of use, so that customers using
the API will respond to this.

Therefore, when the listing is stopped, it is made to disappear after
a certain grace period.

Of course, if it is a listing that has never been sold, it does not apply.

created_at.title: The date and time the record was created
created_at.description: The date and time the record was created.

paused_at.title: Temporary suspension of sales
paused_at.description:
Temporary suspension of sales.

The seller has temporarily suspended API sales for some reason.

Customers can still view the listing on the listing and details page,
but the listing will be labeled as "This listing is suspended by the
seller."

suspended_at.title: Temporary suspension of sales
suspended_at.description:
Temporary suspension of sales.

The seller has suspended sales for some reason.

Customers will not be able to view the listing or details page at all.
At first glance, it looks similar to a soft delete, but the difference is
that the seller and the administrator can still view it, and the sale can
be resumed at any time.

Also, even if the seller has suspended, previous buyers of the listing
can still use the API. The time of suspension of the API can be found in
the {@link IHubSaleSnapshot.expired_at} property.

closed_at.title: The sale end date
closed_at.description:
The sale end date.

If this value is NULL, the sale will continue forever.

IHubSaleSnapshot.IInvert.description:
Reverse reference information of the listing snapshot.

`IHubSaleSnapshot.IInvert` is a data structure interface that
visualizes the reverse reference information of the listing snapshot
from the perspective of {@link IHubCartCommodity}, and therefore, in terms
of DB concept, it corresponds to {@link IHubCartCommodityStock}.

Therefore, `IHubSaleSnapshot.IInvert` does not have all {@link IHubSaleUnit},
{@link IHubSaleUnitStock}, and {@link IHubSaleUnitStockPrice} records of
the listing snapshot, but only has elements that are in the
{@link IHubCartCommodity shopping cart}.

name.title: The representative name of the unit
name.description: The representative name of the unit.

primary.title: Whether it is a main unit or not
primary.description:
Whether it is a main unit or not.

It is a simple notational attribute, and has no meaning beyond labeling.

required.title: Whether this unit is mandatory
required.description:
Whether this unit is mandatory.

If this unit is mandatory, the customer cannot purchase it without
excluding it.

purposes.title: Purpose of extracting released units
purposes.description:
Purpose of extracting released units.

Refer to {@link IStudioRepositoryReleaseNode.Purpose}.

connector_icons.title: List of connector icons
connector_icons.description:
List of connector icons.

The connector icon represents the icons of external services that
this property is linked to.

migrated.title: Whether the tool has been transferred from Studio v1.0
migrated.description: Whether the tool has been transferred from Studio v1.0.

IHubSaleUnit.IInvert.description:
Reverse reference information of the sale unit.

`IHubSaleUnit.IInvert` is a data structure interface that visualizes
the reverse reference information of the sale unit from the perspective of
{@link IHubCartCommodity}, and therefore, in terms of DB concept, it is a
structure corresponding to {@link IHubCartCommodityStock}.

Therefore, `IHubSaleUnit.IInvert` does not have all {@link IHubSaleUnitStock}
records of the sale unit, but only has elements that are in the
{@link IHubCartCommodity shopping cart}.

choices.title: Selection information for this stock
choices.description:
Selection information for this stock.

What options and candidate values were selected by each customer.

candidate.title: Information about the candidate values selected by the customer
candidate.description: Information about the candidate values selected by the customer.

value.title: Customer descriptive information
value.description: Customer descriptive information.

IHubSaleUnitStockChoice.IInvert.description: Reverse reference information for final stock selection.

type.title: Type of option
type.description: Type of option.

variable.title: Variable
variable.description:
Variable.

If this attribute value is `true`, this option will change the
{@link IHubSaleUnitStock final stock} that the customer purchases,
depending on what the customer selects as the
{@link IHubSaleUnitOptionCandidate candidate value}.

On the other hand, if this value is `false`, whatever the customer selects
as the {@link IHubSaleUnitOptionCandidate candidate value}, it will not
affect the {@link IHubSaleUnitStock final stock}. It is just simple
information for the seller to refer to.

type.title: The type of the descriptive option
type.description:
The type of the descriptive option.

What format should it be entered in?

IHubSaleUnitDescriptiveOption.IInvert.description: Back reference information for descriptive options.

name.title: Representative name of the candidate value
name.description: Representative name of the candidate value.

IHubSaleUnitOptionCandidate.description:
Selectable candidate values in the option.

`IHubSaleUnitOptionCandidate` is an entity that represents individual
candidate values that can be selected from
{@link IHubSaleUnitSelectableOption "select" type options}.

- Case
  - Option) RAM: 8GB, 16GB, 32GB
  - Option) GPU: RTX 3060, RTX 4080, TESLA
  - Option) License type: Personal, Commercial, Education

However, if the type of the attributable option is not "select"
({@link IHubSaleUnitDescriptiveOption}),

this entity is not needed.

threshold.title: Threshold, fixed amount {@link fixed} number of free API calls you can make
threshold.description: Threshold, fixed amount {@link fixed} number of free API calls you can make.

IStudioRepositoryReleaseNode.description:
Information about individual nodes that make up the distribution program of the
repository.

`IStudioRepositoryReleaseNode` is an entity that embodies programming nodes that
the user has specified and exported within the program distributed from the repository.

For reference, the types of nodes that can be exported include user-defined functions
and workflow documents.

Of course, {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} also results in a single function
as a build result, so ultimately, a node means a "reusable function" exported from
this repository.

In addition, each exported node has its own endpoint on the Rest API. Therefore,
each node in the repository can be used by `importing` in other programs,
but it is also possible to call it externally through the Rest API. And it is also
possible to register and sell it as a {@link IHubSale listing} of Generative Hub.

IStudioRepositoryCommit.description:
Repository commit information.

The act of editing each of the {@link IStudioRepositoryBucket buckets} that make up the
{@link IStudioRepository repository} and recording its history is called a "commit."
And `IStudioRepositoryCommit` is an entity that visualizes the commit action performed by
the {@link IHubCustomer customer} who has write permission to the repository.

That is, the creation of this commit record means that at least one bucket has been modified,
and thus snapshot records for them have been newly created.

However, issuing a commit does not mean that the commit is complete. If the
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at} property, which indicates the time of its
record confirmation, is `null`, the {@link IStudioRepositoryBucket buckets} can be
continuously modified, and even the commit currently being modified can be canceled and
deleted.

structure, but a dedicated structure only for Nestia.

IStudioRepositoryReleaseDocument.description:
Document of the repository distribution program.

`IStudioRepositoryReleaseDocument` is an entity that visualizes a document written
for a program distributed from a repository. It is responsible for the title, body,
and descriptive information such as attached files or thumbnail images.

For reference, the title or body contents described in
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease distribution program} have a considerable impact
on the hit rate of LLM (Large Language Model). In addition, the distribution program
originally allows each {@link IStudioRepositoryReleaseNode node} to be reused or
a bundle of them to be registered as a {@link IHubSale listing} and sold, and the
descriptive part at this time tends to have a great impact on the customer's
purchasing decision.

This is why a new deployment record must be issued and the version must be changed,
even though the document has no internal node or connector configuration information
changed at all from the previous release, and even the target
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} is completely the same, and only the title or
description text has changed.

That is, because the content of the description is considered as important as the changes
in the internal files and nodes, the distribution program and the description content
structure are fixed to 1:1, not 1:N.
