IStudioMetaChatSession.description:
Meta LLM chat session information.

`IStudioMetaChatSession` is an entity that visualizes the Meta LLM chat
session and its history.

Therefore, `IStudioMetaChatSession` contains the most basic information of
the chat session, such as {@link customer opener customer} and
{@link created_at opening time}, and the sub-entities
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection} and
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage} contain the session connection information
and the mutually transmitted and received message history, respectively.

For reference, our Meta LLM chat session uses the WebSocket protocol and
[TGrid](https://tgrid.com/docs/remote-procedure-call/)'s RPC
(Remote Procedure Call) concept. Therefore, the sub-entity
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection} records the client's
connection/disconnection information to the WebSocket server, and
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage} records the RPC function calls and
return history between the server and client.

customer.title: Chat session connection customer information
customer.description: Chat session connection customer information.

IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection.description:
Meta LLM chat session connection information.

`IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection` is an entity that visualizes the connection
information of {@link IHubCustomer customer} to the
{@link IStudioMetaChatSession Meta LLM chat session}.

That is, whenever a customer connects to a Meta LLM chat session using the
WebSocket protocol, an `IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection` record is created for
that session, and when the customer disconnects the WebSocket, the time is recorded
in {@link disconnected_at}.

connection_id.title: {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection.id} of the session connection
connection_id.description:
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection.id} of the session connection.

If you need detailed information about the session connection,

you can directly query {@link  {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection} through
the provided SDK API.

speaker.description:
Who is the speaker?

It means who is the originator of the current message, and conversely, it also means
the type of RPC function caller.

That is, if this attribute value is "customer", the client called the server's
{@link IStudioMetaChatService} RPC function, and conversely, if this attribute value
is "agent", the server called the client's {@link IStudioMetaChatListener} RPC function.

- customer: Customer (human)
- agent: LLM Agent (robot)

data.title: Message data
data.description:
Message data.

Information on the call and response data of RPC functions.

created_at.title: The date and time the message was created
created_at.description: The date and time the message was created.

completed_at.title: The time when the message (function call) is completed
completed_at.description: The time when the message (function call) is completed.

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageIStudioMeta.description:
Meta LLM chat session message information.

`IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage` is an entity that records messages that occurred in a
{@link IStudioMetaChatSession Meta LLM chat session}. To be precise, it records which
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection WebSocket connection} within the chat session
it occurred in.

And since our Meta LLM chat session uses TGrid's
[RPC (Remote Procedure Call)](https://tgrid.com/docs/remote-procedure-call/)
concept in the WebSocket protocol, this `IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage` is also an entity
that encompasses {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData}, the history information for
RPC function calls.

reaction.title: The return value of the target RPC function
reaction.description:
The return value of the target RPC function.

When calling an RPC function from a server to a client, it is the return value of the client function,
and when calling an RPC function from a client to a server, it is the return value of the server function.

However, since the function call is not always successful, an error may have occurred instead of the return value,
so {@link IExecutionResult}, which corresponds to the union type of returned value and thrown exception, was used.

> The original attribute name `return` is semantically correct, but it was intentionally avoided because it is a reserved word.

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData.ITalk.description:
Conversation message data.

{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.talk} from server to client or
{@link IStudioMetaChatService.talk} from client to server RPC (Remote Procedure Call)
function call and response data information.

reaction.title: The return value of the target RPC function
reaction.description:
The return value of the target RPC function.

When calling an RPC function from a server to a client, it is the return value of the client function,
and when calling an RPC function from a client to a server, it is the return value of the server function.

However, since the function call is not always successful, an error may have occurred instead of the return value,
so {@link IExecutionResult}, which corresponds to the union type of returned value and thrown exception, was used.

> The original attribute name `return` is semantically correct, but it was intentionally avoided because it is a reserved word.

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData.IFunct.description:
Function call plan description message data.

{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.explainFunctionCall}
RPC (Remote Procedure Call) function call and response data information
from server to client.

functions.description:

general.description: A description of the entire plan.

steps.title: A list of descriptions for each function call
steps.description: A list of descriptions for each function call.

IStudioMetaChatFunctionCallPlan.description:
Description of the Meta Chat Agent's function call plan.

`IStudioMetaChatFunctionCallPlan` is an interface that the server uses to explain
the function call plan to the client in a Meta LLM chat session. It contains a
description of what functions Meta LLM will call and the overall/development level
of the call plan.

In RPC (Remote Procedure Call),
it is used in the {@link IStudioMetaChatListener.explainFunctionCall} function.

reaction.title: The return value of the target RPC function
reaction.description:
The return value of the target RPC function.

When calling an RPC function from a server to a client, it is the return value of the client function,
and when calling an RPC function from a client to a server, it is the return value of the server function.

However, since the function call is not always successful, an error may have occurred instead of the return value,
so {@link IExecutionResult}, which corresponds to the union type of returned value and thrown exception, was used.

> The original attribute name `return` is semantically correct, but it was intentionally avoided because it is a reserved word.

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData.ISelec.description:
Function selection message data.

{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.selectFunction}
RPC (Remote Procedure Call) function call and response data information
from server to client.

function.description: Meta information about the function being called.

IStudioMetaChatFunctionCall.ISelect.description:
Information about the function that LLM chose to call during the chat.

When LLM selects a function to call by understanding the context during a
conversation with a user,

the Meta LLM server notifies the client by calling the
{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.selectFunction} function.

x-wrtn-placeholder.description:
Placeholder value for frontend application.

Placeholder means the value to be shown in the input field as a hint.
For example, when an email input field exists, the placeholder value
would be "Insert your email address here".

jmesPath.title: Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression
jmesPath.description:
Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression.

`Prerequisite.Props.jmesPath` is a string typed property that extracts desired values
from the prerequisite API response using a JMESPath expression. This property simplifies
and replaces the `label`, `value`, and `array` properties.

JMESPath expressions are used to extract the desired data based on the API response.
The expression must always be a valid JMESPath syntax.

- Type: `jmesPath: string`
- Example: `"members[*].data.title"`
- Usage: `jmespath.search(response, jmesPath)`

Note: The `label`, `value`, and `array` properties are no longer in use.

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

label.title: Transform function returning label
label.description:
Transform function returning label.

`Prerequisite.Props.label` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the label from the element instance of the
prerequisite API respond array.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are
always `elem`, `index` and `array`. Of course, the function's
return type must be always `string`.

- type: `label: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => string`
- example: `return elem.title`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", labelScript)(...)`

value.title: Transform function returning target value
value.description:
Transform function returning target value.

`Prerequisite.Props.value` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the target value from the element instance of
the prerequisite API respond array. If you've defined this `Prerequisite`
type to a `number` type, the returned value must be actual number type.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are always
`elem`, `index` and `array`.

- type: `value: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => Value`
- example: `return elem.no`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", valueScript)(...)`

array.title: Transform function returning array instance
array.description:
Transform function returning array instance.

`Prerequisite.Props.array` is a string typed property representing
a function returning an array instance from the response of the
prerequisite API.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter name is
always `response`.

If the prerequisite API responses an array and it is the desired one,
you don't need to specify this property.

- type: `array: (response: Response) => Elemenet[]`
- example: `return response.members.map(m => m.data)`
- how to use: `new Function("response", arrayScript)(response)`

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

x-wrtn-prerequisite.title: Prerequisite API endpoint for the schema
x-wrtn-prerequisite.description:
Prerequisite API endpoint for the schema.

`x-wrtn-prerequisite` is a property representing the prerequisite API
interaction. It means that, the endpoint API should be called before

If the target operation returns nothing (`void`), the `output`
would be `undefined`.

name.title: Representative name of the function
name.description:
Representative name of the function.

The `name` is a repsentative name identifying the function in the
{@link IHttpLlmApplication}. The `name` value is just composed by joining the
{@link IHttpMigrateRoute.accessor} by underscore `_` character.

Here is the composition rule of the  {@link IHttpMigrateRoute.accessor}:

> The `accessor` is composed with the following rules. At first,
> namespaces are composed by static directory names in the {@link path}.
> Parametric symbols represented by `:param` or `{param}` cannot be
> a part of the namespace.
>
> Instead, they would be a part of the function name. The function
> name is composed with the {@link method HTTP method} and parametric
> symbols like `getByParam` or `postByParam`. If there are multiple
> path parameters, they would be concatenated by `And` like
> `getByParam1AndParam2`.
>
> For refefence, if the {@link operation}'s {@link method} is `delete`,
> the function name would be replaced to `erase` instead of `delete`.
> It is the reason why the `delete` is a reserved keyword in many
> programming languages.
>
> - Example 1
>   - path: `POST /shopping/sellers/sales`
>   - accessor: `shopping.sellers.sales.post`
> - Example 2
>   - endpoint: `GET /shoppings/sellers/sales/:saleId/reviews/:reviewId/comments/:id
>   - accessor: `shoppings.sellers.sales.reviews.getBySaleIdAndReviewIdAndCommentId`

tags.title: Category tags for the function
tags.description:
Category tags for the function.

Same with {@link OpenApi.IOperation.tags} indicating the category of the function.

description.title: Description of the function
description.description:
Description of the function.

`IHttpLlmFunction.description` is composed by below rule:

1. Starts from the {@link OpenApi.IOperation.summary} paragraph.
2. The next paragraphs are filled with the
   {@link OpenApi.IOperation.description}. By the way, if the first
   paragraph of {@link OpenApi.IOperation.description} is same with the
   {@link OpenApi.IOperation.summary}, it would not be duplicated.
3. Parameters' descriptions are added with `@param` tag.
4. {@link OpenApi.IOperation.security Security requirements} are added
   with `@security` tag.
5. Tag names are added with `@tag` tag.
6. If {@link OpenApi.IOperation.deprecated}, `@deprecated` tag is added.

For reference, the `description` is very important property to teach
the purpose of the function to the LLM (Language Large Model), and
LLM actually determines which function to call by the description.

Also, when the LLM conversates with the user, the `description` is
used to explain the function to the user. Therefore, the `description`
property has the highest priroity, and you have to consider it.

deprecated.title: Whether the function is deprecated or not
deprecated.description:
Whether the function is deprecated or not.

If the `deprecated` is `true`, the function is not recommended to use.

LLM (Large Language Model) may not use the deprecated function.

parameters.title: List of parameter types
parameters.description:
List of parameter types.

If you've configured {@link IHttpLlmApplication.IOptions.keyword} as `true`,
number of {@link IHttpLlmFunction.parameters} are always 1 and the first
parameter's type is always {@link ILlmSchema.IObject}. The
properties' rule is:

- `pathParameters`: Path parameters of {@link IHttpMigrateRoute.parameters}
- `query`: Query parameter of {@link IHttpMigrateRoute.query}
- `body`: Body parameter of {@link IHttpMigrateRoute.body}

```typescript
{
  ...pathParameters,
  query,
  body,
}
```

Otherwise, the parameters would be multiple, and the sequence of the
parameters are following below rules:

```typescript
[
  ...pathParameters,
  ...(query ? [query] : []),
  ...(body ? [body] : []),
]
```

Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression.

`Prerequisite.Props.jmesPath` is a string typed property that extracts desired values
from the prerequisite API response using a JMESPath expression. This property simplifies
and replaces the `label`, `value`, and `array` properties.

JMESPath expressions are used to extract the desired data based on the API response.
The expression must always be a valid JMESPath syntax.

- Type: `jmesPath: string`
- Example: `"members[*].data.title"`
- Usage: `jmespath.search(response, jmesPath)`

Note: The `label`, `value`, and `array` properties are no longer in use.

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

label.title: Transform function returning label
label.description:
Transform function returning label.

`Prerequisite.Props.label` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the label from the element instance of the
prerequisite API respond array.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are
always `elem`, `index` and `array`. Of course, the function's
return type must be always `string`.

- type: `label: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => string`
- example: `return elem.title`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", labelScript)(...)`

value.title: Transform function returning target value
value.description:
Transform function returning target value.

`Prerequisite.Props.value` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the target value from the element instance of
the prerequisite API respond array. If you've defined this `Prerequisite`
type to a `number` type, the returned value must be actual number type.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are always
`elem`, `index` and `array`.

- type: `value: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => Value`
- example: `return elem.no`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", valueScript)(...)`

array.title: Transform function returning array instance
array.description:
Transform function returning array instance.

`Prerequisite.Props.array` is a string typed property representing
a function returning an array instance from the response of the
prerequisite API.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter name is
always `response`.

If the prerequisite API responses an array and it is the desired one,
you don't need to specify this property.

- type: `array: (response: Response) => Elemenet[]`
- example: `return response.members.map(m => m.data)`
- how to use: `new Function("response", arrayScript)(response)`

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

x-wrtn-prerequisite.title: Prerequisite API endpoint for the schema
x-wrtn-prerequisite.description:
Prerequisite API endpoint for the schema.

`x-wrtn-prerequisite` is a property representing the prerequisite API
interaction. It means that, the endpoint API should be called before
calling the target API, for composing some argument value.

x-wrtn-secret-key.title: Secret key for the schema
x-wrtn-secret-key.description:
Secret key for the schema.

`x-wrtn-secret-key` is a property means a secret key that is required
for the target API endpoint calling. If the secret key is not filled,
the API call would be failed.

x-wrtn-secret-scopes.title: Secret scopes for the schema
x-wrtn-secret-scopes.description:
Secret scopes for the schema.

`x-wrtn-secret-scopes` is a property means a list of secret scopes that
are required for the target API endpoint calling. If the secret scopes
are not satisfied, the API call would be failed.

x-wrtn-placeholder.title: Placeholder value for frontend application
x-wrtn-placeholder.description:
Placeholder value for frontend application.

Placeholder means the value to be shown in the input field as a hint.
For example, when an email input field exists, the placeholder value
would be "Insert your email address here".

exclusiveMinimum.title: Exclusive minimum value restriction
exclusiveMinimum.description:
Exclusive minimum value restriction.

For reference, even though your Swagger document has defined the
`exclusiveMinimum` value as `number`, it has been forcibly converted
to `boolean` type, and assigns the numeric value to the
{@link minimum} property in the {@link OpenApi} conversion.

exclusiveMaximum.title: Exclusive maximum value restriction
exclusiveMaximum.description:
Exclusive maximum value restriction.

For reference, even though your Swagger document has defined the
`exclusiveMaximum` value as `number`, it has been forcibly converted
to `boolean` type, and assigns the numeric value to the
{@link maximum} property in the {@link OpenApi} conversion.

Secret key for the schema.

`x-wrtn-secret-key` is a property means a secret key that is required
for the target API endpoint calling. If the secret key is not filled,
the API call would be failed.

x-wrtn-secret-scopes.title: Secret scopes for the schema
x-wrtn-secret-scopes.description:
Secret scopes for the schema.

`x-wrtn-secret-scopes` is a property means a list of secret scopes that
are required for the target API endpoint calling. If the secret scopes
are not satisfied, the API call would be failed.

x-wrtn-placeholder.title: Placeholder value for frontend application
x-wrtn-placeholder.description:
Placeholder value for frontend application.

Placeholder means the value to be shown in the input field as a hint.
For example, when an email input field exists, the placeholder value
would be "Insert your email address here".

jmesPath.title: Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression
jmesPath.description:
Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression.

`Prerequisite.Props.jmesPath` is a string typed property that extracts desired values
from the prerequisite API response using a JMESPath expression. This property simplifies
and replaces the `label`, `value`, and `array` properties.

JMESPath expressions are used to extract the desired data based on the API response.
The expression must always be a valid JMESPath syntax.

- Type: `jmesPath: string`
- Example: `"members[*].data.title"`
- Usage: `jmespath.search(response, jmesPath)`

Note: The `label`, `value`, and `array` properties are no longer in use.

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

label.title: Transform function returning label
label.description:
Transform function returning label.

`Prerequisite.Props.label` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the label from the element instance of the
prerequisite API respond array.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are
always `elem`, `index` and `array`. Of course, the function's
return type must be always `string`.

- type: `label: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => string`
- example: `return elem.title`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", labelScript)(...)`

value.title: Transform function returning target value
value.description:
Transform function returning target value.

`Prerequisite.Props.value` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the target value from the element instance of
the prerequisite API respond array. If you've defined this `Prerequisite`
type to a `number` type, the returned value must be actual number type.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are always
`elem`, `index` and `array`.

- type: `value: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => Value`
- example: `return elem.no`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", valueScript)(...)`

array.title: Transform function returning array instance
array.description:
Transform function returning array instance.

`Prerequisite.Props.array` is a string typed property representing
a function returning an array instance from the response of the
prerequisite API.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter name is
always `response`.

If the prerequisite API responses an array and it is the desired one,
you don't need to specify this property.

- type: `array: (response: Response) => Elemenet[]`
- example: `return response.members.map(m => m.data)`
- how to use: `new Function("response", arrayScript)(response)`

exclusiveMinimum.title: Exclusive minimum value restriction
exclusiveMinimum.description:
Exclusive minimum value restriction.

For reference, even though your Swagger document has defined the
`exclusiveMinimum` value as `number`, it has been forcibly converted
to `boolean` type, and assigns the numeric value to the
{@link minimum} property in the {@link OpenApi} conversion.

exclusiveMaximum.title: Exclusive maximum value restriction
exclusiveMaximum.description:
Exclusive maximum value restriction.

For reference, even though your Swagger document has defined the
`exclusiveMaximum` value as `number`, it has been forcibly converted
to `boolean` type, and assigns the numeric value to the
{@link maximum} property in the {@link OpenApi} conversion.

The `additionalProperties` means the type schema info of the additional
properties that are not listed in the {@link properties}.

If the value is `true`, it means that the additional properties are not
restricted. They can be any type. Otherwise, if the value is
{@link ILlmSchema} type, it means that the additional properties must
follow the type schema info.

- `true`: `Record<string, any>`
- `ILlmSchema`: `Record<string, T>`

jmesPath.description:
Function returning transformed values using JMESPath expression.

`Prerequisite.Props.jmesPath` is a string typed property that extracts desired values
from the prerequisite API response using a JMESPath expression. This property simplifies
and replaces the `label`, `value`, and `array` properties.

JMESPath expressions are used to extract the desired data based on the API response.
The expression must always be a valid JMESPath syntax.

- Type: `jmesPath: string`
- Example: `"members[*].data.title"`
- Usage: `jmespath.search(response, jmesPath)`

Note: The `label`, `value`, and `array` properties are no longer in use.

method.title: HTTP method to call the endpoint
method.description: HTTP method to call the endpoint.

label.title: Transform function returning label
label.description:
Transform function returning label.

`Prerequisite.Props.label` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the label from the element instance of the
prerequisite API respond array.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are
always `elem`, `index` and `array`. Of course, the function's
return type must be always `string`.

- type: `label: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => string`
- example: `return elem.title`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", labelScript)(...)`

value.title: Transform function returning target value
value.description:
Transform function returning target value.

`Prerequisite.Props.value` is a string typed property representing
a function returning the target value from the element instance of
the prerequisite API respond array. If you've defined this `Prerequisite`
type to a `number` type, the returned value must be actual number type.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter names are always
`elem`, `index` and `array`.

- type: `value: (elem: Element, index: number, array: Element[]) => Value`
- example: `return elem.no`
- how to use: `new Function("elem", "index", "array", valueScript)(...)`

array.title: Transform function returning array instance
array.description:
Transform function returning array instance.

`Prerequisite.Props.array` is a string typed property representing
a function returning an array instance from the response of the
prerequisite API.

The function script must be a string value that can be parsed by
`new Function(string)` statement. Also, its parameter name is
always `response`.

If the prerequisite API responses an array and it is the desired one,
you don't need to specify this property.

- type: `array: (response: Response) => Elemenet[]`
- example: `return response.members.map(m => m.data)`
- how to use: `new Function("response", arrayScript)(response)`

reaction.title: The return value of the target RPC function
reaction.description:
The return value of the target RPC function.

When calling an RPC function from a server to a client, it is the return value of the client function,
and when calling an RPC function from a client to a server, it is the return value of the server function.

However, since the function call is not always successful, an error may have occurred instead of the return value,
so {@link IExecutionResult}, which corresponds to the union type of returned value and thrown exception, was used.

> The original attribute name `return` is semantically correct, but it was intentionally avoided because it is a reserved word.

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData.IFillA.description:
Function argument filling message data.

{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.fillArgument} from server to client
RPC (Remote Procedure Call) function call and response data information.

For argument information configured by the client, refer to {@link reaction}.

additionalProperties.title: Additional properties' info
additionalProperties.description:

The `additionalProperties` means the type schema info of the additional
properties that are not listed in the {@link properties}.

If the value is `true`, it means that the additional properties are not
restricted. They can be any type. Otherwise, if the value is
{@link ILlmSchema} type, it means that the additional properties must
follow the type schema info.

- `true`: `Record<string, any>`
- `ILlmSchema`: `Record<string, T>`

One of type schema info.

`IOneOf` represents an union type of the TypeScript (`A | B | C`).

For reference, even though your Swagger (or OpenAPI) document has
defined `anyOf` instead of the `oneOf`, {@link OpenAiComposer} forcibly
converts it to `oneOf` type.

function.title: Endpoint information of the function that LLM called
function.description:
Endpoint information of the function that LLM called.

It can be undefined for the legacy reason.

reaction.title: The return value of the target RPC function
reaction.description:
The return value of the target RPC function.

When calling an RPC function from a server to a client, it is the return value of the client function,
and when calling an RPC function from a client to a server, it is the return value of the server function.

However, since the function call is not always successful, an error may have occurred instead of the return value,
so {@link IExecutionResult}, which corresponds to the union type of returned value and thrown exception, was used.

> The original attribute name `return` is semantically correct, but it was intentionally avoided because it is a reserved word.

function.title: Endpoint information of the function that LLM called

If this attribute value is `null`, it means that the connection to the target

itself is successful, the response status of the HTTP protocol is recorded
regardless of the success or failure of the function call {@link success}.

In a Meta LLM chat session, when a call to {@link ISelect specified function}

The Meta LLM chat server notifies the client of the success or failure of the call
of the function, as well as the return value, by calling the client's
{@link IStudioMetaChatListener.complete} function.

IStudioMetaChatWorkflowPlan.description:
Meta Chat Agent Workflow Plan Description.

`IStudioMetaChatWorkflowPlan` is an interface that the server uses
in a Meta LLM chat session to describe the {@link IStudioWorkflow Workflow} plan
that has been prepared for the client. It contains a description of what kind of
workflow Meta LLM will configure and the overall/development level of the
configuration plan.

Used in the {@link IStudioMetaChatListener.prepareWorkflow} function in RPC
(Remote Procedure Call).

IStudioMetaChatWorkflowConfirm.description:
Workflow acceptance information in Meta LLM chat.

`IStudioMetaChatWorkflowConfirm` is an interface that, in a Meta LLM chat session,
when the server notifies the client that the {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow} is ready
to be created, the client responds by providing the {@link IStudioAccount account},
the {@link IStudioRepository repository}, the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit},
and additional description information to which the workflow will be recorded.

It is used in the {@link IStudioMetaChatListener.workflow} function in RPC
(Remote Procedure Call).

IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageIStudioMeta.description:
Meta LLM chat session message information.

`IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage` is an entity that records messages that occurred in a
{@link IStudioMetaChatSession Meta LLM chat session}. To be precise, it records which
{@link IStudioMetaChatSessionConnection WebSocket connection} within the chat session
it occurred in.

And since our Meta LLM chat session uses TGrid's
[RPC (Remote Procedure Call)](https://tgrid.com/docs/remote-procedure-call/)
concept in the WebSocket protocol, this `IStudioMetaChatSessionMessage` is also an entity
that encompasses {@link IStudioMetaChatSessionMessageData}, the history information for
RPC function calls.

IStudioRepository.description:
Studio Repository.

`IStudioRepository` is an entity that represents an individual repository
within the studio system, and is similar to the concept of GitHub's repository
in online services. And physically, it can be likened to a disk drive.

And the repository belongs to a specific {@link IStudioAccount account}, and the
account owner who owns each repository can be a {@link IHubMember member} or a
{@link IStudioEnterprise company}. In addition, the account owner who created the
repository can use the repository with fellow members or
{@link IStudioEnterpriseTeamCompanion team members} through the
{@link IStudioRepositoryAccess access control} of the repository.

IStudioRepositoryAccess.description:
Repository access control.

`IStudioRepositoryAccess` is an entity that embodies the access control of
{@link IStudioRepository repository}. It is an entity that is recorded when
{@link IStudioAccount account holder} shares the repository authority to other
{@link IHubMember members} or {@link IStudioEnterpriseTeam team} of the company.

As a reference, the account holder who created the repository is also a target of
access control. In other words, as soon as the account holder creates the repository,
one record of this table is created and started.

IStudioRepositoryDirectory.description:
Folder information in the repository.

`IStudioRepositoryDirectory` is an entity that visualizes folders existing in
{@link IStudioRepository repository}, and is a type of
{@link IStudioRepositoryBucket bucket}.

And when a folder is first created, and whenever it is modified or the path is changed,
the details are stored in the DB as a unit called a snapshot and tracked. In addition,
all modifications to these folders are grouped into a unit called
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} and are done at once. Therefore, by viewing
past folders, it is also possible to view the previous history of each folder.

IStudioRepositoryFile.description:
File information of the repository.

`IStudioRepositoryFile` is an entity that visualizes files existing in
{@link IStudioRepository repository}, and is a type of
{@link IStudioRepositoryBucket bucket}.

And when a file is first created, and whenever it is modified or its path is changed,
its history is stored in the DB as a unit called a snapshot and tracked. In addition,
all modifications to these files are grouped into a unit called
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} and are done at once. Therefore, by viewing
past files, it is also possible to view the previous history of each file.

Whether to transfer the account.

A method of issuing a new account to the company rather than transferring
the customer's account to the company.

account.title: A new account code to be issued to the company
account.description: A new account code to be issued to the company.

migrate.title: Whether to transfer the account
migrate.description:
Whether to transfer the account.

If this value is set to `true`, the company will not issue a new account,
but will take over the current member's account as is. And the new account
issued with the code written in {@link new_account_for_customer} will be given
to the current member.

new_account_for_customer.description:
After transferring the account to the company, the new account code to be
issued to the customer.

The company takes over the current customer's account as is. And a new account
is issued with the code written in this property `new_account_for_customer`.
Of course, if this value is `null`, the customer becomes "no account" after
transferring the account to the company.

IStudioWorkflowTemporary.description:
Workflow temporary storage information.

`IStudioWorkflowTemporary` is an entity that visualizes the case where
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} is temporarily stored before
{@link IStudioRepositoryCommit.archived_at commit confirmation}.

Note that the entity that temporarily stores the workflow document is the
front application, and each temporary storage record is deleted in bulk at
the moment when the {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} is confirmed.
Also, for the temporary storage records for the associated commit and workflow
document, they are automatically deleted even if they exceed N.

erase.title: Whether to delete
erase.description:
Whether to delete.

Whether to view the temporary storage record and delete the record.

document.description: Input information for the workflow document to be temporarily saved.

IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow.description:
Workflow being worked on is placed on the bookshelf.

`IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow` is an entity that represents the "workflow document
placed on the bookshelf of the workspace" by the customer.

Note that the concept of "placed on the bookshelf of the workspace" means that the
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} has not been distributed even once. If a
specific workflow document has been distributed even once, it is classified as
{@link IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow}, which means the bookshelf of the distribution unit.

Also, the access path of the workflow on this entity is not ({@link IStudioAccount account} ->
{@link IStudioRepository repository} -> {@link IStudioRepositoryCommit commit} ->
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow}), but rather the concept of gathering everything on
the bookshelf at once. Therefore, this entity contains the associated repository and
commit information. And only the most recent commit's workflow is placed on the bookshelf.

IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow.description:
Released workflow program is put on the bookshelf.

`IStudioShelfReleaseWorkflow` is an entity that visualizes the "workflow document
put on the bookshelf of the distribution room" by the customer.

Note that the concept of "put on the bookshelf of the distribution room" means that
the corresponding {@link IStudioWorkflow workflow document} has been
{@link IStudioRepositoryRelease released} at least once. If the corresponding workflow
document has not been deployed yet, then it is classified as
{@link IStudioShelfCommitWorkflow}, which means the bookshelf of the work room.

Also, the access path of the workflow on this entity is not ({@link IStudioAccount account} ->
{@link IStudioRepository repository} -> {@link IStudioRepositoryRelease release} ->
{@link IStudioWorkflow workflow}), but the concept of gathering everything on the bookshelf
at once. Therefore, this entity contains both the repository and the release information.
And only the most recent release of the workflow is placed on the bookshelf.

total_count.title: The total number of workflows
total_count.description:
